snippet: Students at Florida’s public colleges and universities who are U. S. citizens or legal residents cannot be charged out-of-state tuition if their parents are in the country illegally, a federal judge has ruled.
abstract: Federal District Court Judge K Michael Moore rules that students at Florida’s public colleges and universities who are United States citizens or legal residents cannot be charged out-of-state tuition if their parents are in the country illegally.
lead_paragraph: Students at Florida’s public colleges and universities who are U. S. citizens or legal residents cannot be charged out-of-state tuition if their parents are in the country illegally, a federal judge has ruled.

headline.main: Florida: Judge Rules Against Tuition Inequality
headline.print_headline: Florida: Judge Rules Against Tuition Inequality
